website_summaries.verdict: Built to seal around the face rather than the eye sockets, these goggles are much more comfortable for younger swimmers, with a hair-friendly snap closure.
pros: Many users like the side-snap closure, and that the goggles seal around the face rather than eyes, which is more comfortable for kids
Lenses are clear above and under water, and anti-fog works well
cons: Reports of lens seal failing after a few uses

customer_reviews.title: Got a lemon looks like ...
customer_reviews.text: Seemed "pretty good" until the head strap broke today. Been using this for less than one month so this is a defective item OR the materials are very cheap. Fit was comfortable and I had no issues with water leaking. The anti fog performance was poor. Within one or two laps it was fogging up. 5/6/2018 Update - the second goggles broke again on the strap. This happens 4 days after the return window closed AND I took one week off from swimming. Never buying this brand again. Poor quality if the head strap consistently breaks within one month of solid use.
customer_reviews.author: Scott D. Ethington

customer_reviews.title: I trained in the pool 4 times prior and they worked great. I hit the water for my first triathlon ...
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews, I went for a pair to use for my first triathlon. I trained in the pool 4 times prior and they worked great. I hit the water for my first triathlon and they worked great.... except I am a terrible swimmer. They did their job, but I was pathetic, if they helped me swim better then I'd be thrilled. One note, I got the clear lens and thought that would be fine. I'm here to say no way, if you are swimming outside get smoke or mirrored lenses!!!!!! At the triathlon I was blinded by the rising sun and at that point I wasn't thrilled with the clear lens, but hey that was my choice.
customer_reviews.author: Wreckinball

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with purchase or warranty
customer_reviews.text: They worked good for about 6 weeks then started leaking. The plastic sealing the lenses in seems to have broken and started leaking from around the lens. I did take good care of the goggles putting them in their case or leaving them around my neck when not in use. When I contacted the Aqua Sphere support department it took them THREE WEEKS to reply and I was told, "leaking is not covered under warranty". The goggles also distort vision really bad when looking at black tile with white grout like the lines at the bottom of a pool. My next pair of goggles wont be Aqua Sphere.
customer_reviews.author: Cy3456

customer_reviews.title: Best I have used
customer_reviews.text: I swim about 56,000 yards/month in a pool and these are by far the best goggles that I have used (and I have gone through multiple sets including every model from Speedo). The trick for these I have found is to apply a very light coat of vaseline along the edge that touches your face before use, keeps the rubber supple. Another trick - don't push these on your face to try to get better suction, it has the opposite effect. You need to place them on with a comfortable elastic length, not too tight, they will provide the suction you need no problem.
customer_reviews.author: TPR100

customer_reviews.title: I hate them, I will never buy this brand again
customer_reviews.text: The water enters the lens, I have to squeeze too much so that water does not enter and that causes a headache. It may be the design of the lens, the shape, which does not fit the contour of the eyes. I hate them, I will never buy this brand again. I do not recommend them at all.
customer_reviews.author: Rolando F.

customer_reviews.title: Great Goggles for long swim
customer_reviews.text: they don't leak my face shape,they don't fog(at least not yet)there very comfortable,they adjust with the push of a button and last but not least,they look good.theses are polarized and mirrored which i use on bright sunny days,i also have a second pair with a clear lens which use on overcast days.i gave comhort a 4Iinstead of 5)only because sometimes the button section on the strap can press on my ear if i don't ajust it right,which i can and do,i minor inconvenience thats fixable
customer_reviews.author: wesley david young

customer_reviews.title: AquaSphere anti-fog treatment quality has declined. Not sure I'll every buy again.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th pair of AquaSphere's, 3rd pair of Kayennes. Either general quality has declined or they have quality control or design problems, because the anti-fogging has not worked from when I first used them. I bought the polaroid version and wear in outdoor pool and after just 3 laps, they are fogged! Very disappointed in AquaSphere because they have been my go to goggle for a long time. Especially at $40 price point. Maybe it's time to see if Speedo does better. On the positive side, they do not leak and are comfortable as all my prior Kayennes have been.
customer_reviews.author: j garr

customer_reviews.title: They leak, bad.
customer_reviews.text: After using these goggles only a month, they started leaking like a sieve. Sometimes it's the right eye, sometimes it's the left. Can't find a hole/defect; sometimes they work great for the first 10 minutes of my swim. It's a shame, because they are really comfortable. They don't dig into my nose like other goggles do. I tried to click on the link for the manufacturer website so I can contact them about it, but when I do I get a warning that it might not be legit and a hacker might be trying to intercept.
customer_reviews.author: Moira P.

customer_reviews.title: Underwater Ski Goggles
customer_reviews.text: I wish I'd never bought these ... Pro, the large shape offers greater peripheral vision. Con, they cover so much of the area around the eyes that body heat causes them to fog up. I swim for exercise, hard, and they begin fogging up after about 15 minutes. At 30 minutes they are completely fogged over on the inside and I can barely see anything. I am going to get rid of these and go back to the old fashioned eye cups.
customer_reviews.author: K. Manning

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I swim a few times per week. I personally was getting very frustrated with my goggles that they either didn't fit my face well, or had to be uncomfortably tight so that water wouldn't leak in. These goggles are wonderful and worth the extra price. They are comfortable and don't leak. They aren't completely fog proof, but much better than others we've tried. I also like the tab on the side for easy adjustment of the straps. I got a pair for my husband, and he loves them, too. He appreciates that he can see better peripherally. I would highly recommend these to anyone who swims a lot.
customer_reviews.author: B. Brown

customer_reviews.title: No leaking and clear.
customer_reviews.text: I swim 3 times a week. My goal is always to swim a mile non stop. I want goggles that I don’t have to stop and empty or clear. These are perfect for me. I went through an identical pair which I used for years before they began leaking, and that was partly age and party my fault for not rinsing them in fresh water after use. I wash these off now after every swim. They are great and stay pretty clear and don’t leak at all in a mile of non-stop swimming.
customer_reviews.author: stephen b. lewis

customer_reviews.title: The Best, will not buy any other
customer_reviews.text: We have been buying this Italian brand for years and will not use anything else. They are pricey: It will hurt when your children lose them in the water (buy the floaty that goes on the back of the strap so they float). But they are definitively the best, no rubber, all silicone. I had mine for over five years and am purchasing another just because the strap is beginning to show a crack (still going) and don't want to lose until the last minute.
customer_reviews.author: JC Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I have tried lots of different goggles, usually chosen by low price. I bought these as a splurge and couldn't be happier. They are, by far, the most comfortable goggles I've used. They seal well without having to be too tight which makes them very comfortable. I push off hard and have yet to have a problem. Great purchase; highly recommended. Pros: Seal well. Easy to adjust, very comfortable Cons: expensive. But worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Katica

customer_reviews.title: State of the art anti-fog technology
customer_reviews.text: The lenses started getting foggy at around 100m mark into my swim and I thought, this is not going well. However, at around 200m mark the anti-fog finally kicked in: it allowed a small amount of water inside each goggle, which washed away the fog directly into my eyes, keeping them from drying by providing much needed moisture. It worked so great that I put them directly into the garbage bin, for the next person to enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Maxim Sloyko

customer_reviews.title: Great design for maximum peripheral view
customer_reviews.text: We've had good experiences with Aqua Sphere goggles in terms of comfort and durability. I love this particular design because it provides for maximum peripheral view at relative comfort. Like most swimming goggles, these will sustain clarity for only so long while immersed under water during casual semi-snorkel (without the snorkel) swim, before they begin to fog. Overall, very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: G. Volchek

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and no leaks!
customer_reviews.text: I've worn a large variety of goggles over the last 35+ years and these are by far the best. Typically for me I have to wear overly tight and uncomfortable goggles to avoid any kind of leaks during the swim, these are the first that are not only leak free but very comfortable! The nose of my bridge is quite large and when I first put these on it felt like my bridge was getting a bit crunched, but after a few workouts I don't notice it all and I'm very happy with the fit.
customer_reviews.author: Laszlo

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a set of goggles that did not restrict vision underwater and that I could use for swimming training. This set is comfortable; they adjust quickly and don't get in the way. They fit my face perfectly; this is something I find troublesome with other brands. I bought the clear lens one, for the moment I am swimming indoors, but I would like to get the mirror lens for outdoor swimming. The only con is that they are not the most transparent lens; I have not applied any chemicals to the lens. Overall, they are great, and I like the fit.
customer_reviews.author: Louis M. Del Valle

customer_reviews.title: Best goggles I've had
customer_reviews.text: These are the best fitting goggles I've ever tried, they seal against your face with minimal tightening. They adjust very easily, you either pull the outside to tighten, or press the button to loosen. They have incredible peripheral and the boundaries are barely notable. The anitfog is about the same as any other pair, it will wear off after a while Pros: Easy adjustments Wide view lens Does not have to be incredibly tight to prevent water from coming in Neutral: Would be nice if the case it came in was water proof They don't float but they don't sink like a rock Cons: The anti fog will wear off
customer_reviews.author: Mike H.

customer_reviews.title: Best Googles
customer_reviews.text: Forty years in the pool and I have never found a bettor goggle. This is my fourth pair. they tend to last about a year before they break down and start to leak. That is about 250,000 yards of swimming for me. My only complaint is why to goggle manufactures claim anti fog. I have never found a pair that does not fog up. Still have to spit in them before every swim.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K

customer_reviews.title: Clear but sticky.
customer_reviews.text: Like most swimmers I just want dry eyes, clear vision, comfort and no raccoon eyes without wearing a huge mask. But hard to find! Pros: good shape and outer eye fit. Clear vision and don't have to over tighten, easy adjust and few leaks... But made of that sticky squishy gel, catches skin a little. The "Covert FIT" worked better for me. I kept this for a backup goggle.
customer_reviews.author: CieloS

customer_reviews.title: Great Ironman Goggles
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these goggles for Ironman and long-distance swim training for three years now. LOVE THEM. The buckle allows for easy adjustment if I ever (which is rare) get some water coming in during a swim. Just a quick tug on the strap, one click tighter, and all good. Plus, it stays put for next time. No need to readjust these! I swim about 3x/week in pool and salt water in these without issue. The only negative is that they do require replacing after about 13 months... I mean, can't they last forever?
customer_reviews.author: T. Witt

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful glare/sun protection
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my orange polarized Kayene goggles! LOVE THEM! I've had a dark lense non-polarized pair of Kayene's for about 2 years, but the glare while doing backstrokes was still bugging me. I got these not expecting miracles but boy, they are great! My eyes are SO much happier with these. I wouldn't suggest looking straight into the sun with them, but anything short of that, and you're sure to LOVE them! What I love about the Kayene style is they are so easy to adjust and the wider frame is wonderful. I hope Aqua Sphere keeps making this model.
customer_reviews.author: MzWy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, except for fogging up.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely excellent quality except for one minor flaw. They do fog up. But the fit is perfect and the ease of use to get them perfectly sized is genius! just rinse with water and the fog goes away, and even if they do fog up again, you cannot see the fog underwater. Will buy this brand again when needed.
customer_reviews.author: moviebuff

customer_reviews.title: ... just bought these glasses and I definitely would not recommend them, they do not protect
customer_reviews.text: I just bought these glasses and I definitely would not recommend them, they do not protect, water keeps coming inside and I cannot see when swimming, I used Speedo all the time with no problems and after reading some articles I decided to give these a try. I thought it was me but three different friends tried and it happened the same with every one of my friends. I thought this cannot be true, these are rated as few of the best, so I continued trying several times, my eyes ended up red and with some minor damage, so now I stopped using them. It is unfortunate, I would love to get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Amado

customer_reviews.title: Anti-fog does not work.
customer_reviews.text: Anti-fog does not work. Most of lenses area fogged up within a few minutes; interestingly, there is a patch in the center of the lenses that remained clear so I can see via very limited area. It almost looked like a bad mfg. process / quality control where the anti-fog technology is not applied evenly to the entire lens. I am going to return it since there is NO customer support or warranty support by Aqua Sphere. My last pair of Aqua Sphere leaks after Amazon's the 30 days return period but still under warranty; however, I still have not figure out how to get customer support to honor this warranty!!! Return while you can.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Not for smaller face sizes.
customer_reviews.text: Likes: great vision, didn't fog up in the beginning (you need to get the spray). Dislikes: the goggles are really grippy so it pulls on my hair, it starts to leak so I probably need the woman's size for my smaller face neutral: the adjustment straps are a bit awkward but not terrible. Overall I'd recommend them to people that have a bigger head so it doesn't leak.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Chang

customer_reviews.title: Great goggles!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased my third pair of these in the past several years. The first one, I lost in a lake and the second pair survived daily summertime usage for two years, before they started letting some water in. Admittedly, I don't have a lot of experience with other brands, but I've been very happy with the performance of these goggles. They are water tight, comfortable, and very easy to adjust. If your usage is less than mine, (I'm in the pool at least an hour every day, sometimes more) you will probably see many years out of a single pair. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Clemens

customer_reviews.title: Leaked after one month....
customer_reviews.text: I wore a pair of Aqua Sphere googles all through my Ironman training and bought another pair once my originals had finally called it quits. Within a month of owning my new pair, they are already leaking a ton on one side. I tried to get an exchange as one month of use before they leak is unacceptable but I have had no contact back from the seller. Therefore I would say skip this product as the seller and the product are not holding up to the original Aqua Sphere name.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine K.

customer_reviews.title: Love these googles.
customer_reviews.text: Actually fit better than I expected. Usually goggles are annoying to wear but these fit like they were made for me. And I could actually see as well as I could when wearing my regular glasses, which was odd. They did fog up a little after a half hour but I rinsed them in the pool water and no problems. Well only one, my eyelashes sometimes hit the glasses. LOL Oh and no raccoon eyes when i took them off, love how soft they are over the nose, no more sore nose.
customer_reviews.author: Shadowsfire

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic goggles
customer_reviews.text: These are very high quality, fashionable and I like the fit. I'm a big head, male, 6'0". I swim 2000+ meters at a time (whenever the opportunity arises as I travel extensively). The lenses are bigger than some of the younger, ore "competitive" people might like, but I'm an old (53) geezer and I find the larger lenses more comfortable and the view is better for some of these pools without lane lines and weird walls. I also like the straps and the strap retention clips. I made a leap of faith and bought two pair, the mirrored and the smoke lenses. Very happy so far. Comes with a fairly decent case to keep the scratches at a minimum.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I'm a new swimmer, but I've been hitting the pool about three times a week for about six months. I have used these goggles every day and have never experienced fogging. I did experience some leakage today, for the first time, and was a bit disappointed that this awesome pair of goggles had started to leak. Upon further examination after getting home, I found a small piece of debris had somehow managed to lodge itself onto the seal. My guess is that removing it will fix my leak problem. Even if all I got was six months, I'd have been happy.
customer_reviews.author: Avionics Dude

customer_reviews.title: goggles
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of Aqua Sphere goggles. I'm still using the second pair, but wanted backup (first ones broke after a couple of years). I love the fact that you can loosen the goggles from the clips on the front instead of having to take them off to readjust. Much easier to get them exactly right. They also have a very wide field of vision. I get no water coming into these goggles while swimming laps.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Fit is OK, but pretty blurry underwater
customer_reviews.text: On the upside, the strap fits well and is easily adjustable, they don't leak and they don't fog up to any great degree (somewhat less than other goggles). However... the bridge is a little small and it's not adjustable. They fit OK across my nose but they aren't as comfortable as was hoping for. The biggest problem though is that because the lens is curved (no part of it is actually flat), they are actually blurry underwater. It's not terrible, but don't expect things to be crystal clear. These weren't all that expensive so I can live with it, but I would not buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Les Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great Seal just like the other Aqua Seal products.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these bc I own a pair of Aqua Sphere Seal Goggles and love them. But I wanted a low profile pair that seals and can handle a dive into the water. They definitely can handle a dive but there is something odd about the nose area. The eye seals are great, never fail, no leaks. But the eye seals touch each other leaving no space for my nose. They still work but are just odd. I still prefer the Seal one piece goggles bc there is no distortion with your eyes since they are like they are in a mask.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Blurry Vision!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge Aqua Sphere fan and was excited to move from my favorite tri style to the Kayenne for indoor lap swimming. However something is really messed up with the lenses for me. They are clear out of the water, but when I go under water they are horribly blurry. It is like I'm wearing prescription goggles...it is horrible, I can't focus on the pool bottom. It is really strange, why only under water and not above water I cannot say. Really disappointing. I see only one other similar complaint on reviews here so maybe it is a rare defect?
customer_reviews.author: Big6ft6

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and easy to adjust
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! Haven’t had any issues yet. They are comfortable to wear, easy to adjust and have not had any leakage problems yet. I also love that they came with it’s own travel case! I have a larger head and I don’t have any discomfort over extended periods. The field of view is great as well. I don’t need any of those tiny racing goggles, these larger ones are much better. I have owned many in my life.
customer_reviews.author: C M

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, First-Time Triathlete Approved
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased a cheaper ($10) pair of goggles for training and was disappointed in the lens quality. I saw a dramatic difference making step-up to Aqua Sphere Kayenne goggles. Vision was extremely clear and I had a lot less water getting in the goggles while swimming. They stayed on my head and allowed plenty of visibility during the ocean swim portion of the triathlon. I will certainly recommend these goggles to other friends training for events.
customer_reviews.author: RJB

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable; Great Strap Adjusters; High Quality.
customer_reviews.text: These goggles are some of the nicest I have ever owned and I swam as a child for many years on a sports team. I especially like the quick adjustment straps, they are unlike any I have ever used before and very easy to tighten and loosen without getting hair caught in them, which is a major problem with the standard loop bracket strap adjusters. They do get a little bit tight after wearing them for awhile and will leave some goggle rings, but that is fairly unavoidable if you want them to also be tight enough to keep the water out while moving quickly through the water.
customer_reviews.author: LateralusTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: These goggles are a game changer! I have tried several different brands and Im really happy with these. I swim every morning but as a women in her fifties, I cant afford all of the distress around my eye area. These fit perfectly, from the brow bone to the orbital bone and really comfortable. I highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fogs Up :-(
customer_reviews.text: I used these last Wednesday for my swim class. I liked the ample lens pieces which provided me with a great comfortable view while swimming. It didn't leave my eyes super swollen and no water got inside the lenses. It was extremely simple to adjust them to my preferred pressure level. I was disappointed when these fogged up before the end of my one hour class. I will give these away and try another pair. If I experience the same issue, my review will remain as is. If not, I will update it.
customer_reviews.author: The Bronx

customer_reviews.title: Great design, fit, and comfort, but lenses produce distortion underwater
customer_reviews.text: I really, really wanted to like these. They are highly adjustable, easy to adjust, comfortable, and have a wide field of view. But unfortunately the curved soft plastic lenses produce very annoying distortion underwater. They are fine above water, but once you look underwater, it's like a car's side mirror where things look smaller, and are also slightly blurry. I thought it might be me, but then I tried my wife's Speedo goggles, and those were sharp and distortion free underwater. So as much as I like these for fit and comfort as a recreational swimmer, the underwater distortion is their downfall.
customer_reviews.author: SE

customer_reviews.title: They may not be as streamline as the Speedo Vanquisher but they are not as bulky as the picture leads you to believe and they are comfortable around her eye sockets
customer_reviews.text: My daughter swims competitively and this is the brand and style she consistantly reaches for year after year. They do not leak at all when she dives, strap stays secure and fit her very well. They may not be as streamline as the Speedo Vanquisher but they are not as bulky as the picture leads you to believe and they are comfortable around her eye sockets.. Purchased clear for indoor practice but usually get the smoke lense. We have the TYR Special OPS or Vesi and the Vanquisher but they have all been deligated to 'back up' stock.
customer_reviews.author: kiki

customer_reviews.title: Strap Snapped after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Probably read this already in the reviews, but I ignored it the first time around. The strap snapped on me the other day and I now have a $30 pair of paperweights. Perhaps I will reuse them for a halloween costume, but that was not their original purpose. Not sure if I could have done anything differently, but I always rinsed them after getting out of the pool, but two months of use is quite ridiculous. Nice while they lasted, but they won't last long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy em...or two
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable goggles, have bought two pair (clear and smoke lens), excellent seal against face and I have a perpetual 5 o'clock shadow or full on beard up to my eye balls. Adjustment/click system to get the goggles to fit perfect is very easy and can switch between me and my girlfriend using them without getting into an argument about why she doesn't have her own. Only drawback is they do fog, similar to all other goggles I've used so no real gripe. Have used both in a lap pool and for several sprint triathlons with no problems - however I did loan a pair out and if someone grinds them into concrete at a transition they will scratch.
customer_reviews.author: Wintz

customer_reviews.title: Adjusts easily!  Feels great!  Provides high clarity!
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for about a year and am overall very happy with the purchase. One thing I will say though is that the lenses do scratch VERY easily, even though I babied them and kept them stored in the hard plastic case it arrived in when not in use I still got some pretty good scratches on them. These were never laid face down on any surface, but still many scratches. Besides that, the actual fit and feel was fantastic and I highly recommend them as they are great for lap swimming! :)
customer_reviews.author: AmazonReviewMaster

customer_reviews.title: Leaked After 1 Swim
customer_reviews.text: These were very disappointing for me. I purchased these for lap swimming indoors. The field of vision is great and they are very comfortable, but after the first swim they started to leak like crazy. I tried tightening and adjusting every way I could think of, but it seems like the water may be coming in from the edge of the lens with the pressure of each stroke--it's hard to tell. The design just didn't work for me. Really too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Bell

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and very clear
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few swim goggles but don't think I've liked one as much as I like this particular pair. I've only used them in a pool. They are super comfortable, can see very clearly. Love the grip - not too hard, yet not leaky. If it matters, I have a big head :) Dont know about the longevity yet, but definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Saki Maki

customer_reviews.title: Terrible no good horrible goggles.
customer_reviews.text: I tried a friend's pair on out of the water and they seemed to suction well, so I ordered these. Once I got them, I had the same experience: good suction when dry. However, as soon as I was in the water, they just wouldn't form a good seal. The only way to keep water out was to crank them so tight that I had raccoon eyes for a day. Even without cranking them super tight, since the nose bridge is not adjustable, they ended up bruising the bridge of my nose. They also feel like they're made of the cheapest materials available.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Do not leak-fit great-don't fog
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of aqua sphere swim goggles. The reason why I like this brand so much is they fit the face so well and I have absolutely no leakage. It is very easily adjusted with a very ingenious push system. So far, they have not fogged up, so one would think that they will not. The quality is outstanding. It also comes in a nice plastic case to store it when I'm not using it. I wore speedo goggles for years and was never pleased with the fit, because often they would leak after a while. Switching to this brand was the best thing I have done with regard to being comfortable, with no distractions, when swimming.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy B.

customer_reviews.title: Good seal, very comfy.
customer_reviews.text: These are the nicest goggles you can get for this decent price. My husband does laps regularly and swears by them. I've taken mine in pools and in the ocean, the seal works great. Remember to wash them after use to get rid of the salt or chlorine buildup that eats away at the seal. I've learned thats the number 1 way to wreck your goggles. I've had to buy two pairs since I got one pair stolen, but I think it was still worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Very, very easily scratchable
customer_reviews.text: I have used these goggles only a handful of times, and always store them in a hard shelled case between uses. Even still, the lenses are already scratched because they are made of a very soft plastic. I'd put these closer to a ten dollar value than what I paid for them (almost three times that). They also don't fit my face, so one side will leak unless I make them uncomfortably tight.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Amazing polarized view underwater
customer_reviews.text: Amazing underwater view with the polarized goggles. To preserve the view I use the microfiber cloth of my glasses after 25-30 min of use in the pool to keep it dry from moisture the starts to built up . And also I clean it with tap water and then I dry it with the microfiber cloth after using it each time to avoid formation of minerals. They are also comfortable and leak free.
customer_reviews.author: GGR

customer_reviews.title: Excellent in many aspects
customer_reviews.text: I swim 3-4 times a week and have been using these goggles for the last 5 years or so. I have tried other models and brands, but always go back to this one. Actually, whenever I see them on sale, I usually buy some additional ones to keep as spares... They fit very comfortably and do not leak at all. I would also recommend(if you can find it...), which allows you to replace the regular lenses with diopter lenses (sold separately). Overall, I am extremely satisfied with the Kayenne swimming goggles and I strongly recommend them. Thanks for reading.
customer_reviews.author: C. Engler

customer_reviews.title: Best Goggles for Eyes
customer_reviews.text: Aqua Sphere Kayenne are my favorite swim goggles. They fit well and the size of the goggles fits nicely around the orb of my eye. They do not suction onto the soft skin under the eye. They are adjustable so it is easy to find the right about of suction pressure to secure the fit around the eye and prevent leaking. Because they fit the orb of the eye, they did not cause discomfort and redness around the soft skin of the eye.
customer_reviews.author: emslaine

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about them, but they fog up and have a weird distortion. Bought two pair of Kaiman EXO’s, they don’t fog or distort.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Will Buy Again!!
customer_reviews.text: I started out loving the Aquasphere Kayenne. They are the only goggle I wear when swimming in open water - great peripheral visibility, super comfortable, and I can go almost an entire season without any fogging issues. When I saw that they come in a polarized version, I bought them QUICK! So incredibly worth it!! For training or racing in sunny conditions, these are the best goggles for me!!
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Great for lake races on sunny mornings
customer_reviews.text: Very good goggles for lake swims on sunny mornings. Spotting buoys during a triathlon can be difficult when you're a crooked swimmer (me), and these goggles have helped spot those as well as the other swim caps - way ahead of me - on those sunny mornings.
customer_reviews.author: runnerntexas

customer_reviews.title: Good but lifespan limited due to seal discoloration after long time use.
customer_reviews.text: They work well and last quite a long time. However, the rubber seals started to discolor with something that I could not wash off after about a year of using 2-3 times a week in a clorinated pool. Eventually stopped using them and bought a new pair of a different brand. However, the new brand did not last as long but the rubber seals did not discolor like these did. I suspect the discoloration was a reaction to the oil on my skin. Looked almost like mold but would not come off with scrubbing or scraping.
customer_reviews.author: Wrenchbender13

customer_reviews.title: They have lasted a good season of swimming in the pool and open water ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to wait a few months before reviewing these goggles. They have lasted a good season of swimming in the pool and open water and they look and feel just like the first time I used them. I like that you can see much better with those little speedos goggles. It's all clear and water does not get in your eyes. I have also seemed to notice no fogging. They are best used in open water where you must know where you are going, especially if you are in a race. Love these goggles!
customer_reviews.author: Miguel A. Cuya

customer_reviews.title: good goggles, they work well, but not perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: These are good goggles, I would recommend trying them. They work well most of the time, but still tend to leak a little bit for me. Everybody't face is different and it probably just takes trial and error to find goggles that work best for you.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Burns

customer_reviews.title: No more water in my eyes!
customer_reviews.text: I have always had issues with water getting into my goggles, so I decided to buy these after reading all of the reviews. I have used them many times and they are fantastic goggles. They have a great seal but still very comfortable. I no longer have the issue of water getting in my goggles. Also, these are great for outdoor swimming since it has the smoked lenses it blocks out a lot of glare from the sun. Basically it is like wearing sunglass goggles.
customer_reviews.author: pdas980

customer_reviews.title: Good goggles for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are decent goggles. They do leak after awhile, but I've never found a pair that didn't, so at this point I think that's just an unrealistic expectation for relatively inexpensive swimming goggles. They are light and comfortable and if you work with them you can minimize leak pretty easily. They also don't give me a headache from pressure on the bridge of my nose.
customer_reviews.author: JCO

customer_reviews.title: Leaks when swimming
customer_reviews.text: Leaks and fogs up. I purchased one of these several years ago and they were excellent. But time and pool chlorine caused them to soften and become hazy so purchased these. These were not the same quality. No matter the adjustment, I couldn't get them not to leak. The seal to the face appears to be shorter than my first pair, allowing water to leak in when moving the head swimming.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great for casual swimming.
customer_reviews.text: As someone that's not great at swimming, I found these goggles to be very comfortable and great for helping me during my swimming exercises. If you put them on right and get a good seal, they will not leak. When I first got it, I had constant moments of leaking because I didn't have the right seal and my strap adjustments were horrible. There are these "buttons" you can press that kind of auto-adjusts the strap (it loosens it up to a comfortable adjustment AFTER you tighten it) and I personally thought that the feature helped a lot. You have to play around with it to really use the feature to its full benefit.
customer_reviews.author: yukm

customer_reviews.title: Average goggles
customer_reviews.text: Overall I really like these goggles, so I am a bit sad to put only 3 stars. I love the look, the 180-degree view and the feel when I wear them for 45 minutes or so. That begin said, after a longer period, I get a headache systematically and I have to remove them. They are not too tight but it just hurt around my eyes. Also, they are not better than other googles on certain aspects: fog, they leak occasionally... I was expecting a lot, so I am really disappointed, even if I continue using them from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Julien

customer_reviews.title: Best item on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: After 40 some years of swimming, I finally found a pair of goggles that are actually capable of keeping 100% of the water away from my eyes. I don't like to swim in chlorinated water, but there are not enough outdoor places to swim where I live. So, I'm stuck with the pool at the local family recreational center. They use a LOT of chlorine and it exceptionally hard on my eyes. These googles make it possible for me to swim in that very same pool without any trouble at all. NO water gets to my eyes, they are very easy to adjust, and while they did fog up a bit I didn't mind at all.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H. Albert RN

customer_reviews.title: Swim around Key West must have!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my swim around Key West. The polarization was needed and worked great. They never leaked on me and the comfort was great. I never even thought about them. It’s my second pair but first with polarization. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: No headache or racoon eyes!!! Love them!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these goggles!!! They fit me nice and don't give me a headache or racoon eyes! Love the polarized version because of open water swimming I do. The material is very soft and nice feeling. Love the quick adjustment mechanism. You can adjust even while swimming. Sometimes they leak when pushing off the wall in a swimming pool but that can be adjusted quickly. Love the fact that they have a very wide variety of models..
customer_reviews.author: Rodney

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: Got these to replace a pair that I'd had for 10 years that finally bit the dust. So far, these are working great. There is a slight tint to the lens which is nice for my husbands sensitive eyes. Suction, and comfort are great also.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Bingaman

customer_reviews.title: Best goggles I've ever owned. Search stops here.
customer_reviews.text: These are world class goggles. I don't write Amazon reviews much, but these are the real deal. Made in italy, they're very high quality. I swim a lot, pools indoors, outdoors, in the ocean, lakes, rivers, you name it. I swim for long distance races and these, unlike other goggles, are never painful even after hours of wear. They are very good about not leaking, and the polarization is awesome, helps block light without the darkness that comes with tinted goggles. Highly recommend for any types of swimmer, and I've worn many types of goggles.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Archuleta

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect goggles
customer_reviews.text: I have used these twice. They are comfortable but not perfect for freedom from leakage and fogging. The first time they were leak free and fogged only slightly. The second time in a 1.5k open water race they leaked a bit, fogged early then cleared. The strap system is easy to use and the hard shell case is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Dawes Wilson

customer_reviews.title: I needed to adjust them continuously but decided the frustration was so great that it literally was giving me trauma just thinki
customer_reviews.text: I basically threw these away since the water continues coming into my eyes. I've been swimming for over fifty years and these were not what I expected. I needed to adjust them continuously but decided the frustration was so great that it literally was giving me trauma just thinking about getting into the pool I know, some won't understand this but I swim a mile or so a day and at times just don't feel like doing the routine and any excuse I can have isn't good.
customer_reviews.author: BJ Mack

customer_reviews.title: My favorite goggle design.
customer_reviews.text: Aqua Sphere Kayene Goggles are the best googles out there. For the money, they perform, they don't leak, and they don't fog. This is the only goggle I purchase from now on and this is my third pair. I used these for snorkeling during my vacation, and they worked just as good as my other Keyenne's work in the pool. I love these.
customer_reviews.author: Wins APRVD

customer_reviews.title: Amazing goggles that do not fog or leak!
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to preface this by saying that I'm not much of a swimmer. I needed to buy some new goggles after my old ones started leaking all the time. Wow - that's the word that came to mind when I tried these on. I swam for almost an hour without needing to de-fog my goggles or empty water out. This is in stark contrast to my old Speedo goggles that fogged up and leaked almost every other lap. I found that I was subconsciously reaching for my goggles every so often (to dump out the water) and then realizing that I didn't actually need to! Such a huge difference, I'm just upset I didn't purchase these earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Z.

customer_reviews.title: Used these Around 6 times and don't like them. They fog up terribly even after using ...
customer_reviews.text: Used these Around 6 times and don't like them. They fog up terribly even after using anti fog spray. They also don't fit well on my face. They cause a lot of pain where they seal /eye socket area. My advise if your an average or over average size person these may be the wrong choice due to fit. I have a pair of the Vista and will go back to this style. The vista fit well , cause No pain , don't leak, and don't fog up with a little anti fog spray. They are not as stream line as the kayenne but are so much better in every other way.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: Deepset eye sockets not a perfect fit but...
customer_reviews.text: I have deepset eye sockets and i am looking for the perfect fit goggles to swim. Sorry to say, these are not it but i have had better success and i love them just the same. I try changing adjustments with every swim (which is SO easyto do!) to see if i can figure it out. I have tried many designs, except for a snorkeling mask💡Otherwise I love them! Very comfortable...I use them to swim laps for casual exercise in a chlorinated water swimming pool....and hate to admit it but i am still using saliva as defogger. 😕 any recommendations?
customer_reviews.author: S. G. Adams

customer_reviews.title: No Fog
customer_reviews.text: I kept trying to fix my old googles...with solutions, with spit, with a half cut potatoe (yes yes) and nothing. I decided to get these....so happy. They have stayed true to themselves for a while too. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Maria A Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Super suction!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my word this have a super strong suction which is funny because they still trap water in them. They worked better than most goggles so we still have them and use them, just a bit uncomfortable as it might suck our eyes out one day. Lol
customer_reviews.author: 1CrazyLife4Me

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Excellent field-of-view,
customer_reviews.text: These are good. I use the clear for indoor pools. They have an excellent field of view and they are very comfortable. They keep the water out quite well. I read a lot of complaints about them fogging up. Mine didn't start fogging for 3 months of continual use. When I was done swimming I just rinsed them well with tap water. When they did start fogging up I washed the lenses with the same stuff you use on your glasses then applied the Aqua Sphere anti fog solution to the inside of the lenses. No more fogging.
customer_reviews.author: Roger L.

customer_reviews.title: Great goggles...questionable lifespan
customer_reviews.text: I swim an average of 3 days a week in a chlorinated LA Fitness pool. While I love the comfort and performance of these goggles, I have to purchase two pairs in less than a year and will soon need a third. I honestly don't know if this is typical for goggles but I feel like they should not be worn-out after 3-4 months use. The seal around the eyes becomes brittle and less reliable, even after thorough rinsing in cold water after each use. I do not use any other chemicals to clean the goggles.
customer_reviews.author: Prime User

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable goggles I have ever owned. I have a fairly high nose and narrow face and they fit very comfortably and have very good resistance to leaking. The visibility is perfect for daytime swimming. They are too dark for swimming at dusk. They are easy to adjust and the straps fit my large head well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer RDD

customer_reviews.title: Fit is a personal experience. Comfy even for hard to fit faces like mine. Performance is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Best swim goggles I've ever owned. But I have a wider face with a flat ish wide nose bridge. There is a little fit issue with uneven pressure on my bridge and sides of my eye sockets, but this is mostly my face's issue. I'll likely get used to it. My wife has a narrower face and pronounced nose bridge and she loves the fit. No fogging, no distortion, a pleasure to adjust. Great product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Kuo

customer_reviews.title: It fogs, leaks and scratches easily. Strap broke
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. It scratched right away even though I kept it mostly in the case. It fogs and leaks. To be fair, it is very well possible that this specific model or brand is not suitable to the shape of my head or face hence the leaking. After a year the strap just broke off. It snapped when I was taking it off my head. I just bought the Aqua Sphere Kaiman and looks like might be a better fit. I will provide review on that one once I start using it.
customer_reviews.author: firstbillion

customer_reviews.title: Distorted vision.
customer_reviews.text: Feel great, no leaks, some fog...BUT the vision under water is distorted...I wanted to use these for swimming in the caribbean, but the lens distort the bottom of the pool way too much. I will return these.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: These googles allowed me to feel more comfortable in the pool
customer_reviews.text: All my previous experience with googles left me frustrated. I wear contacts so if any water gets into my eyes I either lose my contact or it is uncomfortable. These googles keep the water eye by forming a tight fit that is easy to control. I can simply click it up one notch if I feel the google is too loose. And the pressure is good, some googles have given me a headache by feeling tight. This is the perfect google. I have felt more comfortable in the pool and taking more laps.
customer_reviews.author: nydunes

customer_reviews.title: Best open water goggles known to man
customer_reviews.text: Without question, these are the best open water goggles I've ever used, and I'm a 60 yea-old open water swimming veteran. From the moment you first put them on in the water and take those first few strokes you know you've purchased the absolute best product for the job. No leaking, excellent comfort and totally wide open vision.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: They are very comfortable and they do a pretty good job of keeping ...
customer_reviews.text: I read all the other reviews and they are all true! They are very comfortable and they do a pretty good job of keeping the water out. The other reviewers were also right about the one and only flaw. They have a slight problem keeping water out when you dive in but to be honest, I really haven't tightened them up any tighter than I have them right now. They are just so comfortable I just didn't want to ruin the fit. I can say that they are by far the most comfortable pair I've ever owned. Spend a little extra money and get a great pair of goggles. Just don't leave them at the pool.
customer_reviews.author: gerard walsh

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable goggles, but they will not stay on your face when diving off the blocks. They just won't, no matter how tight you make them. I wear mine for US Master's swim team practice. When we practice dives, I wear my Speedo Vanquishers. No leaking, minimal fogging. Clyde
customer_reviews.author: Clyde D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: I bought myself a pair a few months ago. I swim laps in our pool for about 4 months out of the year. I had misplaced the old Speedos I was wore for a couple years. They had started to leak and fog up anyway. I ordered these because they were inexpensive but not the most inexpensive. As far as googles are concerned, they're comfortable (as comfortable as goggles can be) and they haven't leaked or fogged up yet. I liked them enough to buy my husband a pair. My head is small and his is big. They fit us both.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Ironman Proven :)
customer_reviews.text: Love it - USE IT in IRONMANS 5 so far - during the 2.4 mile swim and worked flawlessly occasionally can tighten or release mid swim - Has large Surface area so not a "racing" google - but for me its perfect and COMFY which is very important for long swims
customer_reviews.author: Suresh Kari

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable goggles, anti-fog not great, problems with them falling apart
customer_reviews.text: The googles are really comfortable. Really easy to set up. Everything looks a little distorted. Not bad. Just takes some getting used to. The anti-fog coating didn’t work well for me. They started fogging up after about 2 or 3 uses. They started to come apart at the nose piece after a few week. It got to the point that they came apart every time I would adjust them.
customer_reviews.author: Dave W

customer_reviews.title: Made for a man's face...not a child.
customer_reviews.text: I swim about 3 miles a week. I find my goggles to be the most important item when I swim...I hate getting chlorinated water in my eyes! Nike, Speedo, all seem to be made more for a child's face. The Aqua Sphere have always covered what they need to and each pair has lasted me for a year or more. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Great!! I am a big head guy - ...
customer_reviews.text: Great!! I am a big head guy - 7-3/8 ball cap -- and these are a super fit, and wide and clear view. I used the tip to put a very thin film of Johnson's no-tears baby shampoo on the inside of the lenses before going to the pool. Let the soap dry. Gave the goggles a quick wet in the pre-shower water (not as chlorinated as pool water) and they stay fog-free my whole swim session. When did not use the coat of soap, they fogged up quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Lifelong Learner

customer_reviews.title: Finally comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The time I spend swimming laps is much longer now because I’m actually comfortable and these don’t hurt my nose. The comfort means I can swim longer without the distraction of uncomfortable goggles.
customer_reviews.author: jimzartman

customer_reviews.title: Writing Titles is the Hardest Part of a Review
customer_reviews.text: Really nice goggles. I have a tendency to wear my goggles tight, because I don't want a drop of water to get it. Not a drop, no matter how much I thrash around. With other goggles, I have a weird line around my eyes after I take them off, but with these, it isn't as bad. And the tint works well for both indoor pools and outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: TitleWriter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent: worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is my sixth pair. Very comfortable, excellent viability, and keeps the water out. Lasts about a year of 2 swims per week before I replace. I use clear lens for indoor and tinted for outdoor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really Good Googles.
customer_reviews.text: These are great googles. We got a pair of them at a sporting goods store and they my youngest grandson thought they were for him alone. When I said that they're for the family and his brother could also use them, he wasn't too happy about that. I ordered this pair for the family swimming bag. I know that my grandsons will both be pretty happy the next time we go to the pool. They fit well, do not leak and have a darker lenses great for the outdoor pool.
customer_reviews.author: CN1021

customer_reviews.title: Built for comfort and longevity
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended and the dark lens (which has a cooling rather than a darkening effect on the view) is a must-have upgrade. Pay more for these than cheaper ones; they are built for comfort and built to last and need no adjusting during swimming. One point: Choose your vendor well since some people might need to exchange them. Reason: They have a wider spread on each eye than other goggles -- kind of like a swim mask for each eye socket. This means they may not match the bones around your eyes. In my case, I had to try several placements to keep my eyelashes from hitting the lenses. That done, these are my goggle of choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Hendon

customer_reviews.title: What a difference a good pair goggles makes!
customer_reviews.text: I'm just a casual swimmer, but still was annoyed by the poor quality of the various cheap goggles I'd tried... they were difficult to adjust, and usually leaked regardless. These goggles are so much more pleasant to use! First of all, they are simple to adjust, with the push of a button. And there is virtually no leakage. Plus they are quite comfortable. I liked my first pair (with clear lenses) so much that I ordered a second pair with smoke lenses for swimming on sunnier days. Don't waste your time and money on $5 goggles... spend a little more, and get a good pair of goggles like this that will last longer and work FAR better.
customer_reviews.author: mcas

customer_reviews.title: Effective goggles, just not for me
customer_reviews.text: For the shape of my face and the bones around my eyes, these goggles are OK though not great. They were an improvement over the previous pair I had. They fit snugly. After using these goggles for about a month, I then got another pair by Aqua Sphere that work much better as I needed goggles that had bigger frames so they wouldn't press on the bones at my eyebrows and the bones below my eyes. The latest goggles I got are Aqua Lung America Seal Mask (also purchased from Amazon) and they fit my face structure much better. I think that both Aqua Lung goggles are effective in general, just the second pair work better for me personally.
customer_reviews.author: KLBG Marin

product_meta.title: Aqua Sphere Kayenne Swim Goggles - Made in Italy - Adult UV Protection Anti Fog Swimming Goggles
product_meta.description: The Kayenne, Aqua Sphere’s best selling swim goggles, opens up the playing field, quite literally. Oversized lenses with patented curved lens technology gives you style and ultimate comfort while providing an undistorted, expanded, 180-degree field of vision. The super slim microframe keeps the goggles close to the face for superior, low-drag hydrodynamic performance. And the one-touch buckle makes fitting easier than ever. Pair these technologies with Aqua Sphere’s standard UV protection, leak resistance, anti-fog and scratch resistant lenses, and the Kayenne is easily the most superior performance swim goggle available and the perfect choice for a competition, whether in a pool or open water.
feature_bullets: VISION + PERFORMANCE. Created with vision and performance in mind, the Clear Kayenne Swim Goggles are made with an oversized Plexisol clear lens, a Quick-Fit Buckle, silicone strap for comfort, stabilizing nose bridge, and Advanced Fit Technology.
CURVED LENS TECHNOLOGY. Our patented curved lens technology offers the clearest possible visibility and 180° wide field of vision with exceptional hydrodynamics.

UV & ANTI-FOG. Aqua Sphere’s Kayenne Swim Goggles are constructed with 100% UVA/UVB protection. Pairing that with a scratch-resistant anti-fog lens, your swimming goggles will bring you worry-free, crystal clear swims every time.
CLEAR LENS. The Clear Lens transmits a natural light, which makes it ideal for low light and overcast conditions where maximum visibility is required. Great for indoor pools and dark conditions.

WE LIVE TO SWIM. Whether you’re a new swimmer or a seasoned professional, Aqua Sphere products cater to any and every experience level. We are always evolving to provide the most functional and unprecedented gear for your water activities.

WE LIVE TO SWIM. Whether you’re a new swimmer or a seasoned professional, Aqua Sphere products cater to any and every experience level. We are always evolving to provide the most functional and unprecedented gear for your water activities.

WORLDWIDE CHOICE. Aqua Sphere provides the highest quality gear to swimmers far and wide. As the worldwide brand of choice for swimwear, eye protection, training equipment, and accessories, you’re always in good hands.

AQUA SPHERE. Established in Genoa, Italy in 1998, Aqua Sphere was launched by Aqua Lung, as the premier swimming equipment manufacturer for fitness and recreational swimming, aquatic exercise and triathlons.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
